intro: Crepis zacintha, commonly known as the common mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its small, basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces clusters of tiny, yellowish flowers. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in dry meadows and rocky soils. It blooms from late spring to early summer, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Crepis zacintha is generally hardy and adaptable, making it a common sight in various habitats across its native range.
